etymology.description: pictogram: a forked tongue emerging upwards from a mouth (口)
etymology.interpretation: Graph depicts a tongue sticking up from an open mouth, with the fork hinting at the split tip. Later forms stylized the drawing, but the mouth element remains visible at the bottom; it is unrelated to 舍.

examples.chinese: 医生让他伸出舌头检查(醫生讓他伸出舌頭檢查)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng ràng tā shēnchū shétou jiǎnchá.
examples.english: The doctor asked him to stick out his tongue for an exam.

examples.chinese: 辣得我舌头发麻(辣得我舌頭發麻)。
examples.pinyin: Là de wǒ shétou fā má.
examples.english: It’s so spicy that my tongue is numb.

examples.chinese: 紧张得他舌头打结了(緊張得他舌頭打結了)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnzhāng de tā shétou dǎjié le.
examples.english: He was so nervous that his tongue got tied.
